definition: to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: There are always some beggars dressed in filthly clothes hanging around the subway stations.
sentences.chinese: 在地铁车站总有一些穿戴邋遢衣服的要饭的人停留。

sentences.english: The seven colors hill always have crossing.
sentences.chinese: 七色的歧路总有十字路口。

sentences.english: There is a place in our heart for bottled-up memories.
sentences.chinese: 我的心里总有一个柔软的角落，收藏记忆的瓶瓶罐罐。

sentences.english: Before most big storms there is that moment of calm.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数暴风来临之前总有一段时间风平浪静。

sentences.english: It doesn’t matter who you are either. Jaydee always has a way of relating to you.
sentences.chinese: 不仅如此，不管你是谁，杰迪总有方法与你交往。

sentences.english: Wherever he goes, a carload of soldiers goes with him.
sentences.chinese: 不管他去哪里，总有一车士兵跟着。

sentences.english: Self-made men are most always apt to be a little too proud of the job.
sentences.chinese: 白手兴家的人，少不免总有自豪其成就的倾向。

sentences.english: We all have these concerns when planning a vacation.
sentences.chinese: 当我们计划假期时，总有这些顾虑。

sentences.english: Where the mind dwells, intrigues, rests;
sentences.chinese: 那里总有想法盘亘，密谋，或静止。

sentences.english: Behind every overextended kid, there is a well-meaning parent.
sentences.chinese: 每个过度开发的孩子背后，总有一个深思远虑的家长。

sentences.english: That's the standard story, but biology eschews absolutes.
sentences.chinese: 这是标准讲法，但生物学总有例外。

sentences.english: It always gave me the warm fuzzies to read this one.
sentences.chinese: 当我读这本书的时候总有一种暖暖的感觉。

sentences.english: So there's always a lot of great spots.
There are always skylarks , their songs hanging over the field of dark gold.
sentences.chinese: 在深金色的田野上空总有飞翔的云雀以及他们的歌声。

sentences.english: Even if indifference, but he was always a limitless a faith gives teared up.
sentences.chinese: 纵使淡漠无边，却总有一种信仰让泪流满面。

sentences.english: It has always been the special prerogative of young people to look and act weird and shock grown-ups.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人总有特权行为怪异而使成年人震惊。

definition: hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
in the end/after all is said and done
someone/people/anyone/there is someone there/occupied (as in restroom)
you (informal, as opposed to courteous 您[nin2])
